result.execSummary:
The defendant Brady J. Malzhan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling Fond du Lac County 14 CF 649, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling Fond du Lac County 14 CF 649, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling Fond du Lac County 14 CF 649, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
9/30/15:  Pursuant to Restitution hearing held, court orders total restitution in the amount of $34,342.61, including 10% surcharge and previously stipulated amount of $16,717.66.  Joint & Several with 14CF550, Scott Busby, upon conviction.  **Corrected 2nd Amended Restitution Information attached**

Stipulation to restitution in the amount of $16,717.66  from consolidation of Fond du Lac County Case No:  14 CF 649 joint and several with Scott Busby.  Additional restitution to be determined by the District Attorney within 30 days or deemed waived, any objections to be filed within 10 days of notice of determination.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
No use or consumption of intoxicants.  No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.   No possession of drug paraphernalia.  Absolute sobriety.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.  Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.    Defendant shall provide a DNA sample by CALLING the Winnebago County Jail, Work Release Unit, WITHIN 72 HOURS, to set up an appointment during the hours of 8:00 a.m. - 4:00. p.m. Monday through Friday, at 920-232-1915 or 920-232-1919.  Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats., 946.52.

timeConds.notes:
3 months on each count concurrent.  No credit.  No good time. Huber granted, if in compliance with jail facility regulations.  Defendant shall report to the Work Release Unit (M-F/7:30 am to 3:30 pm), within 72 hours of sentence date with a copy of the minute sheet and the completed GPS application to establish report date for serving sentence.  Report date shall be within 60 days of sentence date.  Huber shall be revoked for failure to report and a warrant shall be authorized.

6 months IMPOSED AND STAYED on each count concurrent (with huber).  Stay may be lifted, in whole or in part, upon written request of the agent with approval and order of the court.
